results.title: The Hidden world: a study of insects
results.creator_credit: Jack Haley, Wolper Productions and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how insects can be controlled to ensure human protection from illness. Shows how a bee tells other bees where to find flower nectar, and how winged termites are sent from one home colony to found new colonies.

results.title: The Hidden universe: the brain. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: Tom Bywaters, American Broadcasting Company and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the functions of the brain, including motor control, memory and sensory perceptions. Shows doctors performing a craniotomy, probing different parts of the patient’s brain, and indicating the sensations that this causes. Discusses also the separate functions of the right and left cranial hemispheres. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Hidden side of selling
results.creator_credit: Arthur Swerdloff, Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how sales personnel can increase their sales by learning how to deal with those customers whose reactions are hardest for them to handle. Creates an awareness of the psychological problems and hidden influences frequently encountered but often overlooked in selling situations.

results.title: The Hidden land
results.creator_credit: N.S. Thapa, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: All along India’s northern frontier run the Himalayas, a formidable chain of snow-clad mountains and glacial valleys. Clothed in this cold and glittering mantle lies the kingdom of Bhutan, remote and mystic. This film is a study of this neighbouring kingdom, its people and their art and culture. Narrated by Berkeley Hill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: N.S. Thapa, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: The Hidden half = Nimeh-ye penhan [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Tahmineh Milani, Mohammad Nikbin, Iranian Film Society and Arta Film
results.brief_description: The dutiful wife of an Iranian judge uses her husband’s impending case of a woman facing execution for an unspecified crime to reveal the truth of her past revolutionary activities and to illustrate that the stories of people must be heard before passing judgement. Using the device of a diary and an extended flashback, Fereshteh (Niki Karima, Best Actress, Cairo International Film Festival) explains how her life changed drastically when she went to university, joined the Communist party, then fell in love with a married man. Feminist director Tahmineh Milani was imprisoned by the Islamic Revolutionary Court following the film’s release and is on parole; the film was also pulled from Tehran screens after a month but later returned. Melodramatic at times, the film’s history overshadows its content yet still manages to convey the oppression of Iranian women under an Islamic regime in pre and post revolutionary Iran. In Farsi with English subtitles. Please note: the white subtitles are sometimes hard to read on screen.

results.title: The Hidden Fortress = Kakushi toride no san akunin [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Masumi Fujimoto and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: The story of rival clans, hidden gold and a princess in distress becomes, in Kurosawa’s masterful hands, a thrilling mixture of fairy-tale and Samurai movie, with the finest elements of a John Ford Western and a Shakespearean drama thrown in for good measure. Toshiro Mifune excels in a role which he subsequently made his own - the unmatched warrior - and his skill as horseman and swordsman is matched only by Kurosawa’s skill behind the camera and in the editing suite. Misa Uehara as the princess in exile is a potent mix of strength and vulnerability, and the choreographed set pieces set cinematic precedents which are hard to follow. Also available on VHS [308157].

results.title: The Hidden factor
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Norman Laird and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Alcohol in road accidents. The effect of alcohol and self-control; medical opinion estimates that the official figures on road accidents greatly underestimate the role of alcohol; the need for a scientific standard of intoxication; how the blood test helps police and protects passengers and others on the road; how the carelessness induced by alcohol frequently ends in tragedy. The story follows several people who combine drinking with driving.

results.title: The Hidden curriculum: expectations
results.creator_credit: Janet Isaac, Bruce Moir and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Looks at sex stereotyping in schools. A female teacher and her children discuss the reaction of the children to the teacher’s engagement, and to boys carrying out some activities often thought of as female-oriented, e.g. cooking, sewing. Also includes a discussion between a female principal and other teachers about women at the top and pupils choosing a course/sport regardless of gender. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Hidden curriculum: attitudes
results.brief_description: One of a group of films about sex role stereotyping in schools. Examines the response of students and teachers to a female principal, and her own attitudes to her position. No other credits available.
